page.title: 02A LOCAL ARTIST
page.content: On Tuesday 21st May, a group of five children went to visit{Joe Scarborough a{local artist.}He had black curly hair with a little grey at the sides. He also had a moustache. He wore glasses with silver frames. He lived in a normal semi-detached house at 44 Rupert Road, Sheffield. Mr. Scarborough left school in the l950's with 5 'O' levels. His first job was at Batchelor's pea factory and then he went to work down the pit, this made him start painting. When he came out of the{"dirty black pit"}the light dazzled him and{"all the colours {flared out"}at him. He now paints street scenes of the l950's. He paints in bright colours like the ones he saw when he came out of the pit. The highest price he has ever been paid for a painting was Â£3,750.
